thread.title: 20 years ago, PlayStation emerged as ‘game machine to beat’
thread.title_full: 20 years ago, PlayStation emerged as ‘game machine to beat’ - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Benny Evangelista
title: 20 years ago, PlayStation emerged as ‘game machine to beat’
text:
Photo: Patrick Fallon, Bloomberg print_article_embed|photo-4781979|article-6491892|7 comments_jump_embed|photo-4781979|article-6491892|1 email_share_embed|photo-4781979|article-6491892|1 facebook_share_embed|photo-4781979|article-6491892|2 twitter_share_embed|photo-4781979|article-6491892|3 pinterest_share_embed|photo-4781979|article-6491892|4 reddit_share_embed|photo-4781979|article-6491892|5 google_share_embed|photo-4781979|article-6491892|6 The Sony Corp. PlayStation 4 (PS4) controller and console are displayed during the E3 Electronic Entertainment Expo in Los Angeles, California, U.S., on Tuesday, June 11, 2013. Sony unveiled the PlayStation 4, its first new console in seven years, taking the battle to Microsoft Corp. with a lower-priced machine, original content and fresh titles as it targets a return to video-game dominance. Photographer: Patrick Fallon/Bloomberg The Sony Corp. PlayStation 4 (PS4) controller and console are...
Twenty years ago Wednesday, the original Sony PlayStation hit shelves in North America as the “game machine to beat,” according to The Chronicle’s prescient review. The Sony Corp. Sony unveiled the PlayStation 4, its first new console in seven years, taking the battle to Microsoft Corp. with a lower-priced machine, original content and fresh titles as it targets a return to video-game dominance. Twenty years ago Wednesday, the original Sony PlayStation hit shelves in North America as the “game machine to beat,” according to The Chronicle’s prescient review.
